---
title: "export_default_and_foo.yml"
---

## High-level description
This YAML file defines feature flag configurations for two namespaces: "default" and "foo". It includes detailed specifications for flags, segments, and rules, demonstrating a complex feature flagging system with various flag types, segment definitions, and rollout strategies.

## Code Structure
The file is structured into two main sections, each representing a namespace. Each namespace contains definitions for flags and segments. The flags include variant and boolean types, with associated rules and rollout strategies. Segments are defined with match types and constraints.

## Symbols

### Namespace
#### Description
Defines a namespace for grouping related flags and segments.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| key | string | Unique identifier for the namespace |
| name | string | Human-readable name for the namespace |
| description | string | Brief description of the namespace |

### Flags
#### Description
Defines feature flags within a namespace.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| key | string | Unique identifier for the flag |
| name | string | Human-readable name for the flag |
| type | string | Type of the flag (e.g., "VARIANT_FLAG_TYPE", "BOOLEAN_FLAG_TYPE") |
| description | string | Brief description of the flag |
| enabled | boolean | Whether the flag is enabled or not |
| variants | array | List of variants for VARIANT_FLAG_TYPE |
| rules | array | Rules for flag evaluation |
| rollouts | array | Rollout strategies for BOOLEAN_FLAG_TYPE |

### Segments
#### Description
Defines user segments for targeting specific groups.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| key | string | Unique identifier for the segment |
| name | string | Human-readable name for the segment |
| match_type | string | Type of matching for the segment (e.g., "ANY_MATCH_TYPE") |
| description | string | Brief description of the segment |
| constraints | array | List of constraints for segment matching |

## Dependencies
This YAML file doesn't directly depend on external libraries, but it likely interfaces with a feature flagging system that interprets this configuration.

### Configuration
The file itself serves as a configuration for a feature flagging system. Key configuration elements include:

| Option | Type | Description |
|:-------|:-----|:------------|
| version | string | Version of the configuration format |
| namespace | object | Defines a namespace for grouping flags and segments |
| flags | array | List of feature flags |
| segments | array | List of user segments |

## API/Interface Reference
While not an API itself, this YAML file defines the structure for configuring a feature flagging system. The main elements are:

| Element | Description |
|:--------|:------------|
| Namespace | Defines a group of related flags and segments |
| Flags | Defines individual feature flags with their properties and rules |
| Segments | Defines user segments for targeting |

Each flag can be of type "VARIANT_FLAG_TYPE" or "BOOLEAN_FLAG_TYPE", with different properties and evaluation strategies.

Segments are defined with constraints that determine which users belong to the segment.

This configuration would be consumed by a feature flagging system to determine feature availability and behavior for different users or environments.
